questionListItems.title: What is the Mosque's Befriender Scheme?

answer.body:
The Mosque Befrienders Scheme is a home-based social befriending service for long-term zakat beneficiaires, such as low-income elderly, people suffering from chronic illnesses or people with disabilities (PWD).


The aim of the scheme is for the befrienders to "ziarah" the homes of people whom have been identified as at risk of having low social support and isolated from the community due to their prevailing conditions.


Befrienders are volunteers and their main roles are to provide companionship, offer emotional support and help develop self-confidence in the long-term zakat beneficiaries though regular home visits or ziarah.

questionListItems.title: I would like to register my child to a full-time Primary Madrasah, which Madrasahs can I consider?

answer.body:
There are 4 full-time Madrasahs providing Primary level education. The two all-girls Madrasahs are Madrasah Alsagoff Al-Arabiah and Madrasah Al-Ma’arif Al-Islamiah. The other 2 Madrasahs Madrasah Al-Irsyad Zuhri Al-Islamiah and Madrasah Wak Tanjong Al-Islamiah, take in both boys and girls.


Kindly note that Primary 1 registration is conducted in late March annually. There is a coordinated exercise and each child/ward can only register at one Madrasah. For more information about the recent past Primary 1 registration, please visit this link (https://www.muis.gov.sg/madrasah/Services/Joint-Primary-1-Admission-Exercise)

questionListItems.title: Am I able to claim tax deductions on my donations to OurMadrasah.sg?

answer.body: Currently only donations to Institutions of a Public Character (IPCs) qualify for tax deductions. As madrasahs are not IPCs, the donations do not qualify for tax deductions.

questionListItems.title: Can I donate to madrasah of my choice?

answer.body:
Yes. You have the option of donating to ‘All Madrasah in General’ or select a madrasah of your choice if you donate via credit card or eNETS.


If you choose to make a recurring donation via GIRO, you may also state your preferred madrasah for your contribution.


If you choose PayNow Donations, your contribution will automatically be channeled to ‘All Madrasah in General’.

If you choose to donate the monies to ‘All Madrasah in general’, the monies will be split equally among all the madrasahs.

questionListItems.title: Why is there no receipt for my donation?

answer.body:
We advise that you also check your junk or spam inbox. Otherwise, you may also write in to salam@ourmasjid.sg for us to assist you in providing you a receipt.

There is no receipt for Paynow donations, the bank confirmation of transfer can be taken as proof of donation.

We use Stripe as our Payment Gateway. They are PCI Level 1 Compliant. This is the most stringent level of certification available in the payments industry. All card numbers are also encrypted at rest with AES-256. Find out more here. https://stripe.com/docs/security

questionListItems.title: What is the difference between this donation and Mosque Building and Mendaki Fund (MBMF)?

answer.body:
Mosque Building dan Mendaki Fund (MBMF) which is deducted from every Muslim employees’ monthly salary goes towards paying for the cost of constructing new mosque buildings and the upgrading of older mosques.

All operational costs, such as manpower and utility bills still depend large on donations from congregants. This portal aims fulfil that throughout online donations. All your donations will be channeled to the local mosques to meet their operational needs.

questionListItems.title: Am I able to claim tax deductions on my dinations to Ourmasjid.sg?

answer.body: Currently only donations to Institutions of a Public Character (IPCs) qualify for tax deductions. As mosques are not IPCs, the donations do not qualify for tax deductions.

questionListItems.title: Why are there multiple deductions in a single day on my bank statement when I signed up for a recurring daily donation? Is there an error in the system?

answer.body:
The deductions are automatically generated by our payment gateway platform. There are instances whereby the platform does not trigger a deduction on a weekend but will deduct twice on the following working day, hence multiple deductions in a single day. However, rest assured that the number of deductions will not exceed what you have signed up for.


If you have any further queries, you may contact us at salam@ourmasjid.sg and we can provide you with further details.

questionListItems.title: How do I edit/cancel my subscription?

answer.body: You may edit or cancel your subscription by clicking on the link provided on your receipt. Otherwise, you may also write in to salam@ourmasjid.sg for us to assist you in editing or cancelling your subscription.

questionListItems.title: What is the money collected under OurMasjid.SG used for?

answer.body:
Staffing

Our mosque officers are our front liners. Be it the mosque religious officers (MRO), social development officers (SDO), imam, bilal or noja, they face thousands of you, the congregants, every week. Your donation supports their salaries.


Water/Utilities

Used by congregants for wudhu and other purposes, water usage forms the largest component of our mosques’ utility bills. While we have done a lot to encourage good water-saving habits, the sheer number of congregants visiting our mosques mean that water consumption is high. The need for heightened cleaning and disinfecting regimes due to COVID-19 has also incurred higher costs for the mosques. Your donation helps the mosque defray the cost of water usage and other utilities.


Operations

Operating our mosques require a strong and dedicated team of employees that ensures the space remains comfortable for all, with services offered in the best manner possible. Mosque officers brought many of their programmes such as their regular kuliah online to serve the spiritual needs of the congregants. Your donation will ensure that these programmes can be supported and the officers can continue with the necessary preparations for the reopening of mosques.
